chapter.title: Operating &ceph; Services
chapter.para: You can operate &ceph; services on a daemon, node, or cluster level. Depending on which approach you need, use &cephadm; or the systemctl command.

sect1.title: Operating Individual Services
sect1.para: If you need to operate an individual service, identify it first:
sect1.screen: &prompt.cephuser;ceph orch ps NAME HOST STATUS REFRESHED [...] mds.my_cephfs.ses-min1.oterul ses-min1 running (5d) 8m ago mgr.ses-min1.gpijpm ses-min1 running (5d) 8m ago mgr.ses-min2.oopvyh ses-min2 running (5d) 8m ago mon.ses-min1 ses-min1 running (5d) 8m ago mon.ses-min2 ses-min2 running (5d) 8m ago mon.ses-min4 ses-min4 running (5d) 7m ago osd.0 ses-min2 running (61m) 8m ago osd.1 ses-min3 running (61m) 7m ago osd.2 ses-min4 running (61m) 7m ago rgw.myrealm.myzone.ses-min1.kwwazo ses-min1 running (5d) 8m ago rgw.myrealm.myzone.ses-min2.jngabw ses-min2 error 8m ago
sect1.para: To identify a service on a specific node, run:
sect1.screen: &prompt.cephuser;ceph orch ps ses-min2 NAME HOST STATUS REFRESHED mgr.ses-min2.oopvyh ses-min2 running (5d) 3m ago mon.ses-min2 ses-min2 running (5d) 3m ago osd.0 ses-min2 running (67m) 3m ago

sect1.title: Operating Services on a Single Node
sect1.para: By using the systemctl command, you can operate &ceph; related &systemd; services and targets on a single node.
